title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.9 - Executive order no. 9: requiring the attorney general to supersede the district attorney of westchester county with respect to a certain matter
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.9 - Executive order no. 9: requiring the attorney general to supersede the district attorney of westchester county with respect to a certain matter

State Regulations
TO: THE HONORABLE DENNIS C. VACCO
THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
STATE CAPITOL
ALBANY, NEW YORK 12224
WHEREAS, the New York State Affordable Housing Corporation
received an application, AHC Application No. 800L (the "Application"), from the

Housing Action Council, located in Tarrytown in the County of

Westchester; WHEREAS, allegations have been made that information stated
in the Application is false; WHEREAS, the District Attorney of Westchester County has
requested the appointment of a special prosecutor to investigate these
allegations; and
WHEREAS, I am acquainted with persons, and might be
acquainted with other persons, who could be affected by an investigation
relating to the Application; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to section 3 of Article
IV
of the Constitution of the

State of New York and subdivision two of section
63
of the

Executive Law, hereby request that you, the Attorney General of the State, as
you deem appropriate and necessary after investigation: 1. Attend in person or by one or more of your
deputies or assistants a term or terms of the Supreme Court to be held in and
for the County of Westchester, and that you in person or by said deputies or
assistants appear before any grand jury drawn from any term or terms of said
court, for the purpose of managing and conducting in such court and before such
grand jury or grand juries any and all proceedings, examinations and inquiries
and any all criminal actions and proceedings which may be had concerning or
relating to: (a) any and all unlawful acts or
omissions which may have occurred in connection with the application; (b) any other unlawful acts or omissions
related to or incident to the application or discovered in the investigation or
prosecution thereof; and
(c) any
acts or omissions occurring heretofore or hereafter to obstruct, hinder or
interfere with any inquiry, prosecution, trial or judgment pursuant to or
connected with this requirement. 2. Conduct, manage, prosecute and handle such
other proper actions and proceedings as may come before said term or terms of
court at which any indictments may be found and which may thereafter be tried
pursuant to or in connection with this requirement; and in the event of any
appeals or other proceedings connected herewith, to conduct, manage, prosecute
and handle the same. As of the date hereof, you and your deputies and assistants
supersede the District Attorney of Westchester County, and exercise all the
powers and perform all the duties in respect of the aforementioned actions and
proceedings as the District Attorney of Westchester County would be otherwise
authorized or required to exercise or perform. In any of such actions or
proceedings the District Attorney of Westchester County shall exercise only
such powers and perform such duties as are required of her by you or your
deputies or your assistants so attending. All expenses incurred by you in relation to the
investigation and prosecution of the actions and proceedings enumerated herein, including the salary or other compensation of all deputies and assistants
employed, shall be a charge upon the County of Westchester. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: May 16, 1995
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
